name: noncognitive

not connected with thinking or conscious mental processes: Older children have important noncognitive advantages over their younger classmates. We tried to identify noncognitive characteristics that can predict whether people will be successful in the workplace. Related word
cognitive
More examplesFewer examplesPeople who have the disease may suffer from both cognitive and noncognitive symptoms.Some students scored poorly on non-cognitive measures such as leadership skills.There are many non-cognitive animals who can demonstrate sophisticated behaviour.
